page.title: 11Methodist Chapel,High Lorton
page.content: The{Methodist Chapel}in High Lorton is a tiny,one-roomed building,built in {1840}and then called the{'Wesleyan {Preaching House'. A small porch straight off the road leads into it through a central door, with an arched window on either side. Inside,on the left,there is a steep {bank of pews}with a short central aisle of steps to reach them.Each row has a{door}at its end.On the right is the{pulpit,}with more{pews}on either side of it,but these are all at ground level.Straight ahead there is a small {harmonium. { John Wesley}visited Lorton on three occasions in 1752,1759 and 1761 and preached to a 'large and serious congregation'.Today,however,the Chapel is only used for{one annual service}in summer,for members of all churches,and for the occasional Circuit Meeting.
